com.almasb.fxgl.entity.component

Class MainViewComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.almasb.ents.AbstractComponent
      • com.almasb.fxgl.entity.component.MainViewComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.almasb.ents.Component

    public class MainViewComponent
extends com.almasb.ents.AbstractComponent
    Adds a game scene view to an entity. To change view of an entity use setView(Node).
    Author:
    Almas Baimagambetov (AlmasB) (almaslvl@gmail.com)

    • Property Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MainViewComponent()
      Creates main view component with no graphics.
      MainViewComponent(javafx.scene.Node graphics)
      Creates main view with given graphics.
      MainViewComponent(javafx.scene.Node graphics, RenderLayer renderLayer)
      Creates main view with given graphics and given render layer.

    • Method Detail

      • turnOnDebugBBox

        public static final void turnOnDebugBBox(javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Turns on displaying of bounding boxes. Useful for debugging. Note: this only shows bounding boxes, not each hit box.
        Parameters:
        color - the color to highlight bounding boxes

      • setView

        public void setView(javafx.scene.Node view)
        Set view without generating bounding boxes from view.
        Parameters:
        view - the view

      • setView

        public void setView(javafx.scene.Node view,
                    boolean generateBoundingBox)
        Set view. The generate bbox flag tells the component whether it should generate bbox from the given view. Note: the generated bounding box is an approximation based on the layout bounds of the view object.
        Parameters:
        view - the view
        generateBoundingBox - generate bbox flag

      • setTexture

        public void setTexture(String textureName)
        Convenience method to set texture as view.
        Parameters:
        textureName - name of texture

                       boolean generateBoundingBox)
        Convenience method to set texture as view.
        Parameters:
        textureName - name of texture
        generateBoundingBox - generate bbox from view flag
